Message.Title: November 1999 $53............December 1999 $106
Message.Msg: December 2000 $15 December 2001 $8.85 December 2002 $8.15 December 2005 $39 duh! December 2008 $12 Today $25.... Just with inflation from 1999.... the share price would have to be north of $81 today just to be at even money..... Do you people even look at those books.... Don't you realize.... one will never be able to stretch a gnat's butt over a 6 inch fence post.... even if that person shaves all the hair off that gnat's butt.... it ain't gonna happen.... More and more young people know that Ms Mayer was sitting on Wal*Mart's Board of Directors before being appointed CEO of the exclamation mark behind the word yahoo.... and they all know where Wal*Mart has their Global Procurement Office..... Pipe dreams are only made while the smoke is in the glass.... Real dreams are made once the smoke clears.... Ms Mayer was born in 1975.....the last year America had a trade surplus..... She has only witness trade deficits her whole life.... Sad.... really sad... America had only a mere $533 billion US Government Debt in 1975.... She spends a billion for porn this past month.... but the US Government Debt today is over $16.67 trillion.... If any of you think social media is gonna get US out of that mess.... you sir/madam are one sandwich short of a picnic and three sheets in the wind. If no one "clicks".... the damn smoke stays in the glass.... right along with that pipe dream..... You young people had better wake your butt up.... and soon...!!

Topic.Title: Organic Traffic of Local Corp (46% of Total Traffic) and Total Traffic of Zillow are equal, but Zillow has with 1,850 million

Message.Msg: Lori Chavez comes from Local Corp Debunking 4 Local Advertising Myths 6/21/2013 - MediaPost by Lori Chavez Fact or fiction – local advertising is a waste of online marketing dollars? If you answered fact, you could be missing a potential $38 billion market opportunity. The challenge is how do brands take advantage of deploying the right tools to reach and engage local consumers. Not everyone gets it right. Of all the misconceptions brand marketers have about ad networks and local advertising, perhaps the most critical is that it can’t be done well. In reality, it’s been something of an after-thought. As a result, some brands don’t embrace the nuanced approach necessary to target those markets in a way that drives desired results. Today, it’s essential to debunk some of the long-standing myths that are holding local advertisers back from success in their local market. Here are four brands need to know to avoid the pitfalls of misinformation

Yes, Basket is a bore Bird.

I think Coldone sold all his YHOO holdings. He is gone for good. The only way he gets back posting again is when he buys back YHOO shares at this price which I think he should. I think YHOO will get to $30 to $35 this year.
Coldone made it clear he would be back and will not sell a share until Alibaba goes public. How can you get it so wrong? Going through life as dimwitted as you are must be difficult.

Move on buddy. He was smart to sell when he was ahead. He didn't want to experience the heartbreaking break-up deal between YHOO and MSFT again. He is gone for good. Ask him to buyback some YHOO shares then you will see him very active again posting here otherwise forget hero Coldone.

His sentence is just about served and if he hasn´t bent over to pick up dropped soap he should be able to sit down by his computer in the coming days to tell you to buy as he has been doing since Yahoo dropped under $28 over 5 years ago.

Bravo, unless you know something about a new deal between YHOO/MSFT, I don't think that would be why Cold has chosen not to post under that alias. (~~, Geez, he is "gone for good" yet all one has to do is "ask him to buy back some YHOO shares" & the "hero" will return. I don't get the feeling that Cold is that easy. No, Bravo sorry, I think you are underestimating how complex Cold is & you of all people should know better - eh. No, no, Cold thrives on adulation, I think he is waiting for those that miss him to beg.

RGYT
